jobTitle: Research Scientist, Senior Biomedical Research Associate, and Biomedical Research Associate
jobDescription: Research Scientist, Senior Biomedical Research Associate, and Biomedical Research Associate Location  TX - San Antonio Job Code 4662 # of openings 3Apply NowLaulima Government Solutions is looking for a qualified Research Scientist, Senior Biomedical Research Associate, and Biomedical Research Associate to support an orthopedic trauma program in San Antonio, TX. ​​Each position varies in support requirements: Research Scientist to advise and lead the OT multifunctional animal research team in all aspects of conducting animal research to include: experimental design, protocol preparations, submissions, IACUC approvals, protocol execution, data collection, and interpretation; additionally the research scientist performs tissue level quantification and analysis of therapeutic compounds and their metabolites using mass spectrometry and high performance liquid chromatography.Qualifications: Knowledgeable in a relevant field of the life sciences. Ability to independently plan, execute, analyze, and report on their research through their graduate dissertation. Will be expected to execute their assigned tasks, and to share their findings with other members of the project team. Expected to write reports and publications, and present their findings in meetings.Senior Biomedical Research Associate to provide assistance with animal research on orthopedic injury, tissue regeneration using stem cell therapy and scaffolds; and the prevention of infection; by assisting the OT multifunctional research team with all aspects of conducting animal research to include: surgical procedures, animal handling, imaging, microscopic and molecular techniques; Performs 3-D image reconstruction and quantitative analysis of X-rays, MicroCT scans and CT Scans; performs bio-luminescence and fluorescence detection and analysis with photon capturing/counting technologies. Qualifications: Desires experience with a variety of the field's concepts, practices, and procedures. Follows instructions and guidelines to perform the functions of the job, including but not limited to relevant Standard Operating Procedures, national standards of research technical accuracy, and/or other written guidelines provided. Plans and accomplish goals, participates in development of research work plans, proposals, budgets, and agreements.Biomedical Research Associate to provide research support on orthopedic injury, tissue regeneration using stem cell therapy and scaffolds; and the prevention of infection; by supporting the OT multifunctional research team with all aspects of conducting animal research to include: surgical procedures, animal handling, imaging, microscopic and molecular techniques. Qualifications: Desires knowledge of commonly-used concepts, practices, and procedures within the particular field.
